stem: A 62-year-old man is called for a review following a positive faecal occult blood. During counseling for colonoscopy, he inquires about the percentage of patients who will be diagnosed with colon cancer following a positive fecal occult blood test. Which of the following is your answer?
disc:
Americans have a lifetime risk of 6-8% for colon cancer. There are approximately 50,000 deaths per year and 95% of these deaths can be prevented by screening for colorectal cancer.

Although colonoscopy is the best method to detect cancer, a fecal occult blood test can detect colon cancer with a positive predictive value of 5-15%. However, there is a 30 - 45% chance of having an adenoma with a positive fecal occult blood test.

Therefore the best answer is 5 - 15%.
